name: Web Accessibility Compliance
description: In this course, you will learn about the standards in place to guide developers in creating a web that is accessible to all users as well as techniques to help bring your projects up to those standards.

accessibility_support.name: Material provided ahead of time, if requested
Handouts, slides, and other material in accessible formats - for example, large print or braille
Handouts, slides, and other electronic material is accessible - all content meet [WCAG](https://www.w3.org/WAI/standards-guidelines/wcag/), at least Level AA
Media fully accessible - including audio and video used in sessions, and recordings of sessions provided afterwards - see [Making Audio and Video Media Accessible](https://www.w3.org/WAI/media/av/)

name: Web Accessibility
description: In this course, you will get hands-on experience making web applications accessible.

accessibility_support.name: Material provided ahead of time, if requested
Handouts, slides, and other material in accessible formats - for example, large print or braille
Handouts, slides, and other electronic material is accessible - all content meet [WCAG](https://www.w3.org/WAI/standards-guidelines/wcag/), at least Level AA
Media fully accessible - including audio and video used in sessions, and recordings of sessions provided afterwards - see [Making Audio and Video Media Accessible](https://www.w3.org/WAI/media/av/)

name: Certified Professional in Accessible Technologies
description: Recognition of professionals who have acquired the knwoledge and skills to implement accessible technologies.

accessibility_support.name: Facility and area accessible to participants - for example, the building entrance, meeting room, presentation stage, and bathrooms are accessible

[Assistive listening devices](https://www.w3.org/WAI/teach-advocate/accessible-presentations/#ald) (ALD), [interpreters](https://www.w3.org/WAI/teach-advocate/accessible-presentations/#terps), and [captioners](https://www.w3.org/WAI/teach-advocate/accessible-presentations/#captions), provided as needed
[Captions](https://www.w3.org/WAI/media/av/captions/) and/or [transcripts](https://www.w3.org/WAI/media/av/transcripts/) for audio
[Description of visual information](https://www.w3.org/WAI/media/av/description/) - integrated description, audio description, or text description
Pre-session technology check, if requested - dedicated time to participants set up any relevant technology, or additional settings

name: Web Accessibility Specialist
description: This credential is intendend for accessibility professionals who are expected to evaluate the accessibility of existing content according to technical standards and guidelines.

description: This online training covers creating accessible document content and structure, evaluating the accessibility of documents, and optimizing the accessibility of PDFs.

name: UX Foundations: Accessibility
description: This course provides the core concepts of accessibility as they apply to UX design, including an overview of the assistive technology visitors may use to access your projects.

accessibility_support.name: Text and important visuals big enough to be read even from the back of the room
Easy-to-read font face

Sufficient contrast between colors (“luminance contrast”) - see [Understanding contrast guidance](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/contrast-enhanced) and [contrast evaluation tools](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/contrast-enhanced#resources)
Reduced use of motion or animations - see [Understanding Animation from Interactions guidance](https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/animation-from-interactions.html)

cost: Free for limited content or duration
